profile.name: Siobhan 'Shiv' Roy
profile.currentTitle: President of Domestic Operations, Waystar Royco
profile.headline: Political strategist turned media executive who managed senatorial campaigns, directed corporate communications during crisis, and led organizational transformation at a $95B global media conglomerate.
profile.executiveSummary: Uniquely positioned executive who built independent credentials in political consulting before transitioning to corporate leadership at Waystar Royco. Brings rare combination of political campaign strategy, stakeholder management, and organizational psychology to executive leadership. Led crisis communications during major corporate scandal, directed organizational restructuring, and managed complex board-level succession dynamics.

evidence.outcome: Managed senatorial campaign achieving 8-point polling reversal in final 6 weeks
evidence.description: Directed campaign strategy, messaging, opposition research, and coalition building for competitive senate race

evidence.outcome: Advised 3 congressional campaigns on messaging strategy with 2 winning
evidence.description: Developed campaign narratives and media strategies for candidates across competitive districts

evidence.outcome: Managed competing interests of family shareholders, institutional investors, and independent directors during succession crisis
evidence.description: Navigated complex multi-stakeholder dynamics where personal, family, and corporate interests intersected

evidence.outcome: Built coalition of board members supporting organizational restructuring proposal
evidence.description: Conducted individual director outreach, addressed concerns, and secured votes for major governance change

evidence.outcome: Diagnosed cultural dysfunction in Waystar executive team and proposed structural remedies
evidence.description: Applied organizational psychology principles to identify toxic dynamics and design governance improvements

evidence.outcome: Led organizational redesign merging 3 Waystar divisions into unified digital-first structure
evidence.description: Designed new organizational model, managed change communication, and oversaw leadership transitions

evidence.outcome: Directed communications strategy during cruises division scandal limiting reputational damage
evidence.description: Coordinated messaging across media, investor relations, employee communications, and government affairs

evidence.outcome: Managed press narrative during CEO succession dispute keeping coverage factual versus sensational
evidence.description: Built relationships with key journalists and provided strategic guidance on coverage framing

evidence.outcome: Overhauled Waystar internal communications framework reaching 120,000 employees
evidence.description: Redesigned employee communications strategy to improve transparency, engagement, and change readiness

evidence.outcome: Negotiated governance provisions in GoJo merger protecting family voting rights
evidence.description: Secured structural protections ensuring Roy family influence in post-merger entity

evidence.outcome: Mediated boardroom disputes between family factions achieving temporary alignment
evidence.description: Applied political mediation skills to corporate governance conflicts

evidence.outcome: Built relationships with 15+ congressional staffers and 3 committee chairs for Waystar policy interests
evidence.description: Leveraged political network to influence media regulation and merger review processes

evidence.outcome: Managed $12M campaign budget across digital, broadcast, and ground operations
evidence.description: Allocated resources across advertising, field operations, and digital campaigns to maximize voter contact

evidence.outcome: Developed 3-year transformation roadmap for Waystar cultural and structural overhaul
evidence.description: Created comprehensive plan addressing organizational culture, governance, and operational efficiency

evidence.outcome: Managed press relationships across 10+ major outlets during corporate and political crises
evidence.description: Built journalist relationships enabling favorable coverage placement and narrative management

evidence.outcome: Assessed and developed leadership capability across Waystar executive team
evidence.description: Applied organizational behavior expertise to evaluate leadership readiness and development needs

evidence.outcome: Proposed board diversity initiatives increasing independent director representation
evidence.description: Advocated for governance reforms bringing diverse perspectives to Waystar board

evidence.outcome: Delivered keynote at Global Women in Media conference to audience of 2,000
evidence.description: Presented vision for leadership transformation in traditional media industry

evidence.outcome: Applied polling data and analytics to refine campaign messaging achieving measurable opinion shifts
evidence.description: Used quantitative analysis to test and optimize political messaging and corporate communications

evidence.outcome: Evaluated C-suite candidates for restructured Waystar leadership team
evidence.description: Applied behavioral assessment and competency evaluation to senior leadership selection

evidence.outcome: Analyzed regulatory proposals affecting media ownership and antitrust enforcement
evidence.description: Evaluated policy impact on Waystar operations and developed advocacy positions

evidence.outcome: Managed organizational change affecting 5,000+ employees during divisional restructuring
evidence.description: Designed and executed change management plan including communication, training, and support programs

evidence.outcome: Identified organizational culture as primary risk factor before external analysts flagged it
evidence.description: Applied systems thinking to connect governance structure, culture, and operational risk

evidence.outcome: Read and navigated boardroom power dynamics achieving coalition support for her positions
evidence.description: Applied political acumen developed in campaigns to corporate governance context

evidence.outcome: Shifted board sentiment on succession plan through targeted one-on-one engagement
evidence.description: Applied tailored persuasion approaches to individual directors based on their priorities and concerns

evidence.outcome: Maintained professional composure during high-stakes family conflicts that affected corporate governance
evidence.description: Separated personal dynamics from professional responsibilities during contentious succession period

evidence.outcome: Raised $4M for senatorial campaign through donor cultivation and events
evidence.description: Built fundraising strategy combining major donor outreach with digital grassroots campaigns

evidence.outcome: Directed $2M digital ad spend across platforms for political campaign
evidence.description: Managed targeted digital advertising campaigns across social media and search platforms

workHistory.title: President, Domestic Operations
workHistory.description: Led organizational transformation, crisis communications, and stakeholder management at $95B media conglomerate. Directed restructuring of domestic media operations.

workHistory.title: Senior Political Strategist
workHistory.description: Managed campaign strategy, messaging, and operations for senatorial campaign. Directed $12M budget and team of 50+ staff.

workHistory.title: Political Consultant
workHistory.description: Advised congressional and local campaigns on strategy, messaging, and stakeholder engagement. Built bipartisan network in DC policy community.

purpose: I don't want a seat at the table. I want to redesign the table.
